head.title: Private Sector; Aviation Executives Keep Their Spirits Up

hedline.hl1: Private Sector; Aviation Executives Keep Their Spirits Up

body.head.byline: By Elizabeth Olson (COMPILED BY MARK A. STEIN)

abstract.p: Joanne W Young to succeed Patricia A Moores as International Aviation Women's Association president (S)

block.p: When you're at the pinnacle of your profession, does it matter that the profession is crumbling all around you? Not to the people at a midyear meeting of the International Aviation Women's Association in Washington last week.

''It's certainly not a wake,'' said Patricia A. Moores, an aviation lawyer who is stepping down as president of the association. ''But no one is grinning from ear to ear. We all recognize problems that we are reading about in the newspapers daily.''

When you're at the pinnacle of your profession, does it matter that the profession is crumbling all around you? Not to the people at a midyear meeting of the International Aviation Women's Association in Washington last week.

''It's certainly not a wake,'' said Patricia A. Moores, an aviation lawyer who is stepping down as president of the association. ''But no one is grinning from ear to ear. We all recognize problems that we are reading about in the newspapers daily.''
Joanne W. Young, also an aviation lawyer, will succeed Ms. Moores at the association, which has 200 members, each with at least five years' experience as an executive in aviation.
